This meant we had people taking over 20 minutes just to get from their floor to the lobby as there were only 2 lifts servicing the whole tower. The main tower had many more operational and no problems and this appeared to show very poor planning and execution. Overall a good hotel but in this case the customer experience was poor and this let down the good reputation they have.

As the Keio Plaza Hotel was the meeting point for the Mount Fuji guides trip to Mount Fuji, we chose it for convenience.It turned out to be better than expected. Great location, close to restaurants, shopping and the metro. Great views from the rooms. And the best part? The price.Will stay here again.
user_name:
GiselleH_13
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: The service, cleanliness and location of this hotel is perfect. The staff are extremely friendly helpful and efficient. The bar on the top floor is responsible priced as well as having a fabulous view over the city.

First visit to Japan and i think all Japanese service staffs were nice to tourists. I waited for 15 minutes for just lining up in the check in area. In fact i wanted to ask for more information on the airport shuttle, however, the staff were super busy. Anyway, the hotel is really close to Shinjuku station West. Don't get wrong there, it has a short cut on basement floor, B1, in the Shinjuku Keio Line train station! Otherwise you have to waste time for finding way there.

front desk staff and concierge could not have been better. Room was clean and well serviced. Hotel really well located. All good. Food in the evening buffet while nice was nowhere near worth 11,000 yen.

First visit to Japan and my group of 5 with three 20 year olds made the Keio Plaza our home base. The rooms were very comfortable. We had a 2 bed room and the boys had the 3 bed room. Bathrooms were incredible for us Americans. Boys couldn't stop raving about them. Bathroom mirror had area that didn't fog up!! View was great from our room in the south tower. As for exploring the Shinjuku station was close which made for easy travel around Tokyo. Good food and shopping were everywhere. We didn't take advantage of the amenities. Top floor bar was closed but the sake bar was nice. Staff were very friendly and polite. Which is standard in Japan. Wanted to try the sushi restaurant but ran out of time. It is one of Tokyo's best so book ahead. Just wish the gym had weights for lifting. Overall highly recommend. We plan to stay there again for the next visit.

Stayed 2 nights post cruise. Thanks to the advice from fellow travellers we decided to stay in this hotel. Location, hotel room, and service is perfect.Location: within walking distance from railway/metro stations. Great shopping centres and restaurants close by. It is also a collection point for Sunrise tours.Hotel room: spacious and modern.Service: what can I say ? The bellboy took us and our luggage to our room and bowed all his way. He showed us all the amenities in the room and even put the slippers right in front of us.5 star all the way ! The room rate is not cheap but ..like everything else in Japan.. Our rate also included breakfast. Breakfast spread is more than adequate and caters for European and Japanese guests. The hotel is huge and has the main building and a South Tower. The locals seem to use the hotel lobby ( which is HUGE ) as a major thoroughfare so it could seem very busy at times. Security wise: anyone could use the hotel lifts and there is no need to use your card ? I suppose Japan is a safe country.The hotel also offers airport bus service : another plus.Will definitely come back.

This was a very nice hotel with spacious rooms, which is a rareity in Tokyo. The staff were most helpful and very friendly. It is conveniently located near the Shinjuku train station - about a 5-10 min walk. There is an airconditioned walkway at the back of the hotel which will take you directly into the station. There is a wonderful convenience shop located inside the hotel which is very well priced selling sushi, small meals, pastries, drinks etc. We bought breakfast from here each morning. The hotel has a free shuttle bus to Tokyo Disneyland and Disney Sea, however, be warned you need to book early as it does get booked out. The only downfall is you need to pay a fee of approx A$33 for a swim each time you enter. However, this is common the in hotels in Tokyo. I would definitely recommend a stay in this hotel.

It's in the middle of the city where you can find a myriad of eating destinations and shops that you can walk to within 5-10minutes. It has a charming entrance and is the meeting place for the Disney shuttle! The rooms are sized just right with the customary automated toilet and Japanese robes. The service is great, as the concierge assisted us efficiently with our tour inquiries. I had just a small glitch understanding their english on the phone, so for any concern, it's better to settle with them at the front desk face to face.Will definitely come back to stay there again.

Overall pretty inconsistent in service delivery. Very clean but the small minor details are often overlooked such as you won't get coffee in the room unless you ask. Bathroom is rather tiny as well but pretty much Japanese standards of hotel accomodation i am guessing. Restaurants and bars are great though.

I stayed at Keio plaza from 01 - 04 JUL and i got south wing which i knew is older building and havent been renovated yet. But when i entered the room, it looks new and all facility can be used. The shower and bath tub was good. They clean my room everyday without i put the "clean sign" in my door.breakfasts is variative. Keio has International, Japanese and also Western breakfast and i could choose it. Throwback to location, i only need 15 minutes walking to Shinjuku main area and hotel is also near restaurants, drug stores.definetely will come back again!

The concierge team was very helpful, the hotel is close by to the subway station. I particularly liked the buffet for breakfast and they have many restaurants within the hotel, plus some nice shops. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon and just one block away there was a small restaurant but so delicious as well as the Government Building which was our first sightseeing place. A great hotel!

A perfect hotel with known level of service. You always receive the same service. It is exactly as you made your reservations. The bed a white clean. A none smoking room - does not smell like some one smoked it it. It is important to make your reservation for a none smoking room.

My family and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. Must say that the location of this hotel is really convenient for travellers as a starting point to explore Tokyo. A short distance away across two blocks would be the Shinjuku station and that gets you anywhere around Tokyo with ease. Coming back to the hotel itself, the hotel looks a bit old but nevertheless it is neat and tidy and a nice ambience too. Breakfast was spoilt for choice as you can sample Continental, Japanese and fusion foods. However the hotel was a bit pricey for my taste but you get what you paid I guess. Hotel is one of the Disneyland free shuttle pick up points and it was convenient for us. Overall the hotel was good. Would consider to stay at Keio Plaza Hotel again.
user_name:
Kwok Kheng W
Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

review_body: Conventional hotel in a great location in Shinjuku. Subway station at back door! Breakfast not included in high price point for room (which was disappointing). Lovely big room by Japanese standards - and we were upgraded. Very much a tour group hotel.

Stayed for 8 nights. Great location for Shinjuku station and underground just a few minutes away. Check in area is like rush hour in the train station, try arrive after 3pm. Stayed in Luxe Plaza room with access to Luxe lounge. Payed A$550 a night only to find that breakfast wasn't included. Luxe lounge in the south tower offers limited wine and beer with a few so called nibbles from 5pm-10pm every night. They have some whisky on offer but only between 5-8pm Mon-Fri really!?Staff in the lounge, lucky if they cracked a smile. If you want to use pool, then that's an extra A$26 each a day. Never have I been a guest at a hotel and had to pay to use the pool. Only plus was free shuttle coach to Disneyland Tokyo. I would never stay here again and would recommend you stay a different hotel.

The hotel is very convieintly located near to the main Shinjuku station. The staff were all very helpful. Rooms was fine, not too spacious but at least average for Tokyo. Breakfast buffet was very good although gets busy at peak times. Overall, a pleasant experience and would certainly book again.

This is a great hotel, located close to Shinjuku Station, one of the largest train and subway stations in Tokyo. The hotel is large, but the service is personal. The rooms were large and spotlessly clean and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. They even provided a couple of complimentary bottles of water each day. There are a number of excellent restaurants in the hotel, with many small excellent eating places nearby. The hotel also has a convenience store with fresh fruit, individual muesli containers, as well as a wonderful patisserie, which enabled us to arrange our own breakfast. The hotel also convenient if you want to do organised day trips as the companies stop at this hotel, as does the airport bus service. Not one complaint - would definitely stay here again.

This stay is a gathering of the clans, me, my husband, our son, Chris, our son, Karl, his wife, Meg, and their daughter, 8-month-old Lotus, Meg's parents, Bob and Martha. We booked two rooms in the south wing (renovated); Bob and Martha stayed at nearby Hyatt.My son, Karl booked from NY where he lives and I tried booking from Sydney, Aust, through the hotel's website - a room with breakfast. However, when I tried to pay, the deal somewhat disappeared. I had to go through Agoda to secure a room - paid the same price of about A$2,900 for the 7nights, one room, no breakfast.As we have booked two rooms at Keio paying a lot and we were staying 7 nights, I asked the hotel if we could at least have one breakfast included for a day when we all had to leave early in the morning for a bus tour. No such luck, the hotel was not all emphatic. No kindness nor consideration there. I was so disappointed. We had no choice but to have a few breakfasts in the hotel - 3,100 yen per person per breakfast - and the breakfast was not anywhere near the quality and refinement experienced in some other 4/5-star hotelsWell, we made a decision and we had to make the best of our hotel choice. But will we be a customers again? I think not. We did not experience what the hotel advertises on its website - "the beauty of Japan in the hotel" and a basic, positive, kind consideration at Keio Plaza Hotel.

The hotel is in 2 towers with more than 1,400 rooms, yet it is so efficiently run that there are no unbearable queues during check in and check out. Moreover, the hotel is quiet. The room is adequately sized, the staff are very helpful and there are those that speak good English. The restaurant outlets of the hotel, however, are all fine-dining, so prices are steep.

We have stayed four nights at this property and my experience has been excellent! From checking in, the bell boy was very polite and eager to help, the managers were nearby the check in counter to greet his guests upon arrival, the check in process was very fast and efficient and they safe keep a package delivered to us; they did not ask for a credit card for incidentals as ours was pre paid which was excellent. As I booked my room many months in advance, I have forgotten that I've requested for a room with Mt. Fuji view as it will be extra special for our wedding anniversary and guess what? Mt. Fuji was in view right in front of our room!The location was excellent as the Shinjuku station was right in front of the hotel, but you have to be very careful where you exit from Shinjuku station, otherwise you will be ended up lost somewhere in the area. Please note that the restaurants at the hotel were all at the higher end. I had a little accident and one of my diamond earrings fell into the sink!! I spoke to the duty manager at the lobby and he arranged to find it. We went out the entire day And when we came back there was a message for us. They found my diamond earring and they arranged to delivere it to my room! Thank you so much for helping me out!I was very impressed with our stay and service at Keio Plaza hotel!
user_name:
RavelsbenC
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel staff spoke great English and was extremely helpful. We stayed there at both the beginning and end of our trip to Japan. Breakfast was included in our booking. There were two restaurants to choose from for breakfast. Food was plentiful and there was a wide variety to choose from. We left breakfast every morning well fed.Currency machine changed was available in the lobby. We changed money as we needed it so left Japan with very little extra pocket change.Rooms were clean and comfortable. We loved our stay at this hotel.A van at Narita drops off at this hotel. You can also book direct transportation back to Narita from the hotel lobby. Vans leave regularly.

Hotel has been renovated some years ago, but with around 1500 rooms this hotels keep on upgrading/renovating its rooms which I must say I find it as a good news. Hotels has some very nice restaurants from Tenpanyaki to Sushi. Bar has nice view at night though staff was a bit slow there every time we visited. Hotel offers good money value. Service is quite good as well, but that is mostly standard in Japan, still staff is polite and I have been very happy with the way all my request were handled.

Keio Plaza hotel is a fabulous hotel for travelers looking for a quiet hotel near Shinjuku. Shinjuku is an area that epitomizes Tokyo (neon lights, bustling streets, busy train stations, modern business skyscrapers, beautiful public parks, vendor-machine restaurants and large shopping malls). The Narita limousine bus stops right in the lobby of the hotel. The hotel also offers free shuttle to Tokyo Disney for their guests which is a welcome bonus for families with children who are planning to go to Tokyo Disney on their trip.

A very large classy hotel frequently used as a wedding venue as it has its own chapel plus banquet rooms.We stayed as a family of three and even with the sofa bed the room was spacious and comfortable. We were on the 22nd floor with magical city lights at night. It's location is quite convenient to both the underground and JR trains and its big attraction is its proximity to lots of eateries and Keio Plaza department stores. There is a wide range of restaurants and for the budget conscious a buffet or even a Lawson within the hotel complex. If you crave western food there is also McD and Subway close by. For overseas tourists keep in mind that you are about 2 hours away from Narita International Airport by bus and you need to not only have paid for the airport transfer(as we had done with our travel agent) but also book a seat via the hotel well in advance. No check in before 2pm is possible even for extra payment so if like us you arrive on a 7am flight they will store your luggage As not many people speak English and the railway system can be somewhat daunting, we recommend booking guided bus trips for your sightseeing. Though best done well beforehand, the hotel has a very helpful tourist desk that can make bookings for you.Although within the hotel you can add your restaurant expenses to your bill, outside shops and eateries only take cash and only selected ATMs take foreign credit cards.

The Keio Plaza hotel is a fantastic spot for travelers exploring all Tokyo has to offer. Situated just a straight 8 min walk to the bustling shinjuku train station with eateries surrounding the vicinity, the keio is strategically placed to be a visitor's headquarters. The hotel itself is first class with the typical, super-high grade staff and service of the Japanese people. The rooms are spacious in comparison to other downtown hotels. Furthermore, the Keio distinguishes itself by the extra 'flash' many very good Toyko hotels do not provide. All-in-all the Keio is a first rate hotel; you will not be disappointed.

Location is very convenient to the Shinjuku shopping areas, Shinjuku Station, bus station,, Keio plaza department stores and many eateries shops.. Airport haneda has shuttle bus to Keio plaza hotel. Superior room we stayed is big enough for 3 people. Check in queue was too long and rooms at south wings takes too long to wait. Staffs are not that helpful with informations and details.
user_name:
GohPauline1200
Bandar Seri Begawan, Brunei Darussalam

review_body: We stayed there from June 13-19. We booked 2 rooms as they are very strict with the number of occupants. We were 6 in the family, including 2 kids. The location is superb. Central to everything. The rooms are spacious too. For our room, we had 3 beds and the other room had 2 beds. We were in the same tower but they couldn't get us adjoining rooms. It wasn't a big deal as we were only 1 floor up and the other room was quite close to the elevator so it was convenient visiting the other room. Our view was the Tokyo Metropolitan Government building! For 6 days, I would wake up and see that building and it's pretty! Just a short distance, we crossed the street and went there for their free observation deck but that's another review! The hotel has lots of travelers, different nationalities and staff spoke good English. They had the limousine bus stop right in front and that's how we came to/from Haneda Airport, again very convenient! We did Mt Fuji tour one day and the meeting place is at the lobby. I only have good things to say about the hotel. For our first time in Tokyo, it was the best decision to get it even if slightly expensive! We will be back for sure.

We booked for 8 nights and 2 rooms.Very big hotel and convenient location.The room are big and the twin bed also very nice and comfort, but there is no sound proof in the room so we can hear the voice from other room conversation (which was very disturbing)In the morning when they clean up next door room, we can hear the noise very clear and when they lifted and dropped the bed really can caused us heart attack.There are three restaurant for breakfast. Glass Court is the best among those three.The queuing was very long every morning and quite boring with the menu due to it never change for our whole stay.The check out time is 11 AM and this is the earliest we ever found (compare to few other countries) and they will never give some compliment for one or two hour late check out although as I mentioned we stay for 8 nights and 2 rooms.The fitness center was nightmare compared to such a huge hotel. It was very small and only have few treadmill with one set body builder unit. Very disappointing.The bell captain service was great while we booked for taxi to Haneda Airport when checked out. As we were unable to request for late check out compliment, the taxi already at the hotel on 11 AM though we booked for 2 PM.Overall the stay are not enjoyed one and we really hardly to consider back to this hotel for future visit.

Keio Plaza is a very big hotel with lots of package tourists. If you are lucky you can enjoy the breakfast lounge. It will depend which room category you booked. I have been upgraded to a newly renovated room which was very big for Japanese standards. A convenience store is located within the hotel (basement). In approx five min walking distance you have a Starbucks cafe which is opening at 7am in the morning. Hotel personnel is nice. Take the airport bus to Haneda which brings you there within approx 40 Min. It's very convenient and affordable for 1400 Yen. Yes, I will return to the Keio.

My family were staying at the hotel for 6 nights. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The younger staff were able to converse with us in English. They are very proactive and will approach us when they felt that we look a bit confuse or need some assistance. Even the chamber lady that we met along the corridor is cheerful and greet us. The staff take pride in their jobs. The location of the hotel is great. A short walk to the Shinjuku area where we can find good food there and many people/lights. When we are back to the hotel, it was quiet and peaceful which my family like it very much. They also provide free shuttle service to the DisneyLand and DisneySea which make our going there very convenient. The airport limousine bus service also stop at the hotel. So we were able to commute to the airport very conveniently. We need not push heavy luggages to the Shinjuku station to board the bus to airport.Why I gave only a overall 4 rating is because the older staff are having some difficulty to converse in English. On the last day, after checking and left the luggages with bell counter, we went and bought some Fuji apples. After returning, I wanted to put my apples in the luggage to be checked in the airport later. At that moment, the senior staff, wearing suit, I presumed the bell captain. I try tell him that I wanted to put my apples inside my luggage and ask him to get my luggage. He keep saying, " You wait outside 10 min before, we bring luggages to bus". That is all he know. I try again and again to explain to him, he later get a bit upset and brought me all the luggages to me, keep quiet and walk back to the bell counter. There were some junior staff around there but they dare not intervene, which I presumed that is the Japanese culture. Later, another younger staff came from somewhere and saw me with the 6 pieces of luggages spoke to me in English and I explained to her. She quickly take care of my luggages and were settled from there on. If all staff are able to understand and best of all converse in English, it will earn a 5 rating from me.

Spent 5 nights at the Keio Plaza July 3-8, 2016. I was a little hesistant because it was an expensive hotel, but the location of this hotel and the convenient options made up for the cost. First, the airport bus from Narita topped directly in front of this hotel. Ditto for the return trip to the airport. Second, Shinjuku station was 10 minutes away on foot (if you don't get lost in the subway zone). Third, there were many cafes, restaurants and stores around the hotel. Fourth, there was a laundromat ten minutes away - they washed and folded our laundry for an evening pick up for under $19. Fifth, we prebooked the free shuttle to Disney Sea - to and fro. Sixth, as first timers to Tokyo, we felt safe and less confused as each day went by because of the central location and proximity to places from this hotel. The room was very spacious. The twin beds were large. The heated toilet seat and bidet was awesome. The tub drain needs a clean to remove a font musty smell and slow drain of water. We had a view of the city from the 24th floor room. We tried the Glass Door restaurant buffet, and it was good. We bought pastries from the basement bakery - yum.

I stayed in this hotel at the end of our holiday with my mom and my sister. We booked 2 rooms for a 3 nights stay.The hotel is nice and clean, quite easy access to shops, resto and shinjuku train station.However, being a hotelier myself, this hotel is far from offering service excellence. Breakfast is average, luxe lounge food is horrible with almost the same cake we had for 3 nights in a row (looks like a left offer cake from breakfast) and not much choices at all during the cocktail hours.But what most dissapointing is that we had to leave very early on the day of departure and one member in the family, due to her condition, cannot rush for breakfast and instead I asked the hotel if they can put small breakfast on the box (for bread, fruit and juice) for her. The answer is a flat 'NO'.What sort of hospitality is this?We stayed in some other 5 stars luxury hotels in japan during this trip, and this stay in Keio Plaza on our last day in Japan really ruin the whole good experience we had in this beautiful country.

I have to say it was the best hotel we stayed at in Japan, the location was perfect because it's opposite the Town Hall and right next to Shinjutsu underground and train station. You can buy a day pass and access the whole of Tokyo right from there! This is a very large hotel, we were on the 21st floor of the central tower and there are several fast lifts to take you to the rooms, we never had to wait long. The room was spacious and at last we had a large bed instead of two separate ones. The room was fully equipped with TV, hairdryer and accessories, aircon and free Wifi. We slept very well and we had buffet breakfast included. We could have breakfast at one of the three restaurants: a western one, a Japanese one and a mixed one. The food was nice and plentiful. We would go back to this hotel!

We spent 6 nights in the Keio Plaza Hotel & it is a great location with a covered walkway to Shinjuku Train station. The staff are very friendly and the service is fantastic, the room was very nice. Most of the staff speak some English. Tip - take a business card from the lobby when you first arrive so you will always be able to get back.
user_name:
Lloyd L
Lower Hutt, New Zealand

review_body: This hotel is good and clean. Breakfast rooms are available with three rooms, and styles. You can see big tall building surrounded this area. And you can walk to shopping area Shinjuku in 10 minutes also. I view from my 23 floor room, and look at Big tall head quarter building outside.

The location is amazing. It is near many shops and is walking distance to the subway. I go there every time I visit Tokyo (Which is quite a lot) The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. What is bad about this hotel is waiting in line to check in as it is very popular. Overall a good hotel.

I've been a frequent visitor of this hotel since 5 years ago.. However, I am completely disappointed with Keio Plaza Hotel's service during this current visit.It started with check-in.. I was aided by a middle-aged lady (named Seiko, I think) in the Premiere counter.. She is the MOST fake, unhelpful, insincere Japanese I have ever met in my multiple visits to Japan.We just came here last week for 3 nights, and returned after travelling up north.I made the reservation online on Keio website, and forgot to change the number of adults to 2, instead of 1 (for those making online reservations, beware!! Their default setting is for 1 adult).She then proceeded to charge me extra for the one person (mind you, for 5,900 yen per person! this is without breakfast)..I implored her, saying that I just came here last week, and showed that I made the correct booking last week. And that it truly was an honest mistake for this visit.She said with a straight face, "5,900 yen."I never encountered such an unhelpful, insecure Japanese who serves customers!!!I think this is very unreasonable considering that I didn't book a standard room..Next, we completely forgot to buy some bottled water.. When we called housekeeping and asked for 2 extra bottles, they said no.. Only 2 bottles per day.Oh what a service!I am afraid that I won't be returning to this hotel anymore.. I am sure they have other good location hotels in Shinjuku.

This hotel is getting up there in age, and so are the people working for this hotel. The hotel is located a few blocks from the west entrance of Shinjuku station and provides somewhat easy access to the trains and limobus to Narita. However the hotel is certainly not new and if you want fast broadband internet this hotel is not it. The hotel doesn't even over RJ45 plug in and only wifi.

Great location, nice large rooms. Very helpful staff. But 2000 yen to use the pool???? Outrageous. For a summer holiday, worth considering a different hotel that doesn't charge for the pool! Breakfast very expensive if not included with room

The location is great for nearby restaurants and shoppings. The hotel is pretty big and easy to get to from the airport by airport limousine.The gym is pretty small but ok during travelling. Nothing really bad about this hotel except the service is just ok so I gave 3 stars.

5 stars local hotel. Good for convention and family stay. Room and big and location are perfect near Shinjuku. Walking distance to shopping and food areas. However, hotel rate little prices. Hotel staff speak English and friendly. Good for big family.

Huge busy hotel in good location. Small bathrooms as most in Japan with shower over bath like most in Japan.We had a club floor room which was high and the club room was a medium size with the usual nibblies and drinks and polite staff. Don't expect the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong club room space and buffet even though the costs aren't that different. We had a comfortable stay for what it was. Space is at a premium here so room average size but 2 large comfortable beds. (We like hard beds which is also a Japanese thing) I've stayed in a lot worse in Japan. Their hotels are getting left behind in comparison to other Asian destinations.

In our group there are6 adults and 2 children. We booked 1 triple room and 2 double bed rooms for our 8 days stay. We book through Agoda, Hotels Combined and Booking.com because its cheaper than booking directly through the hotel website. For the first 4 nights we stay in the old tower and the remaining nights, we stayed in the new tower. *new tower = new room = more expensive*We are unfortunate to meet an unfriendly lady receptionist when we checked in with limited English for communication purposes. We asked her nicely if she can kindly put us (3 rooms) on the same floor. She answered with annoyed look "its 3 different booking reference". IMHO, as long as the room type is the same and available, I don't see booking reference matters?We skipped breakfast in the hotel as there are other breakfast places such as Tsukiji Market and others.My son and I tried lunch in the restaurant downstairs *forgot the name*. Its nothing impressive. *foto attached*My husband and I went for the tea ceremony provided in the hotel. We are only given Japanese mochi and half cup of green tea. There are many department stores around the hotel. About 15-20min walking with toddlers.

We checked in late from our Osaka trip, however when we arrived at Keio Plaza Hotel, Shinjuku, Tokyo, the reception was really nice and helpful and he upgrade our room to a bigger one because the room we booked was full. It's great. We really love our room.

Position is not everything. While it's centrally located at just 10 minutes from Shinjuku station (with even a tunnel connecting the station directly to the hotel, pretty handy if it's raining), the hotel fails to delivery the excellent service we were hoping for. We stayed there for 2 nights after travelling around Japan and this was by far the worst of all structures we visited. For starters, internet in my room wasn't good enough. Slow speed and poor signal, I could only get a decent signal from the bathroom (this was happening with 3 devices, so it was not on my side), If I was in the room, I was getting frequent disconnections. One of the towel was smelly, I know I could have easily asked for a new one, but this shouldn't happen on a 5 star hotel. The room is not super spacious, but it's ok. Also, I always hate the single-dose shampoo and bath lotion, everywhere in Japan we had dispensers, but not here. To sum it up, staff is nice (even though the lady at the cloak room didn't speak english) and the position is ok, but that's about it. Not recommended.

The hotel was arranged by our tour group. Quite luxurious. Buffet breakfast was everything your heart desired. Catered for people with allergies. (Thank you)Beware the swimming pool has an entry fee and is very expensive. $20 AUD.I never had to pay for a hotel pool before! The pool is outdoors and not heated (freezing).

The main reason we pick this hotel is because their free shuttle service to Disneyland and DisneySea. Since the seat is very limited, I highly recommend to reserve the shuttle once you confirm the hotel reservation. In addition, the airport limousine bus has a stop right on the hotel and this hotel offer the luggage service. It is about 10 minutes walk between the hotel to the Shinjuku station and there are several convenient stores nearby. We had stayed in this hotel three times and it is still our number one choice in Tokyo!

The staff were friendly. Room was clean. The bed was bigger than average. Good location. The two reasons why I'm giving this hotel 4 starts is because of the price ($300+) and because of how crowned it was. If I had known better we would have stayed at the same hotel we stayed for the 3 previous nights at $100 at night (Royal Park Hotel).

I picked Keio plaza because of 1) Narita airport limo bus stops here, for a family of four actually cost more than a taxi but more comfortable, about $30 each person, 2) walking distance to Shinjuku station for subway and JR trains, and shops. Most important, I picked Keio because they have a 4-bed luxury room which was perfect for us, my daughter and 2 teenage granddaughters. Being our first family trip together, was great to be in one room. Very comfortable with 2 bathrooms. Upon arrival, we wanted to go find restaurants, alas made the mistake of heading wrong direction, away from the main shopping area. Ask hotel for direction to Shinjuku station, should only be a 5 to 10 minute walk. Any direction but Shinjuku station, you will find office buildings!,

From the time we checked in and after 7 nites, we only have great memories of the hotel, strategically located , near to eateries, metro station, malls and the hotel is really clean. The breakfast at Jurin and glasscourt were excellent value for money. The staffers were well trained and very polite. Front desk were also very helpful as our spoken Japanese was very limited. I would recommend to family with kids to stay here.

The Keio plaza hotel is located right opposite the Tokyo metropolitan building. The room wasn't very big, but I guess ok sized for Japanese standards. Unfortunately the swimming pool wasn't open. The staff was very friendly and polite. Would come again.

This is a very big impersonal hotel. The bellhop on check-in was particularly rude and off handed. He didn't bother taking my luggage and when I asked for help finding my room he just pointed in the direction of the south tower which is quite a distance from the front desk. The room was a decent size. Paying extra for the lounge access is not worth it - very ordinary wine and basically no snacks. I wouldn't stay here again.

Paid to use the pool one hot day in July. Felt it was a good deal for us. All day use, in and out ok. Lunch included for 11000 yen. After busy hot days of sightseeing this was a welcome change. Pool was basically empty and we felt really relaxed. Besides, we were floating around looking at the ahinjuku skyscrapers. Fun!

Though it looks like a big building without any soul, I was impressed by the quality of service in this hotel.The views over the city are beautiful. The rooms are spacious and the bath amenities are good and replaced every day.Everything you need is in the room, even the A/C adapter. Beds are good too.You can choose either japanese or continental breakfast. Both are very good quality.Location is interesting, close to a metro station and to the observatory.All in all a very good place to stay if you want to discover Shinjuku

Arriving from Haneda airport by bus we arrived at Keio, met and greeted by friendly staff that brought our luggage in and set us in line for check-in. English speaking staff no problem, I handed them my confirmed payment and was given 2 room keys, breakfast vouchers. Check-in is with passports and with prepaid room no credit card taken. The room was clean and neat and quite comfortable for my son and I. A big selection of food, convenient store, shops and great location. Would surely book here again. Several tours also met in this hotel lobby.

This hotel has good location, just a short walk from shinjuku station, there is an undercover walkway from the station to right in front of the hotel.There is also a man selling ramen from the back of his truck late at night which is worth a visit.the hotel itself is a bit aged and the service is not very personal. The rooms are average and the bathroom can use a makeover. It's a bit overpriced for what you get.I probably won't stay here again.

This hotel is ideal for first-timer family holidays to Tokyo. If you are worried about locating the hotel after the long flight, its comforting to know that the Airport limousine stops right at the hotel door step for you to arrive un style. It also provides complimentary shuttle service to Disney Land and Sea. But remember the seats are limited and needs to reserve early to avoid disappointment. The Family Room is very large by Tokyo standards and hospitality standards were good. It is also close to major JR Shinjuku station and other private rail lines. Convenient if want to do day-trips to Tokyo surrounds like Hakone, Mt. Fuji, etc. As usual, its also near to all amenities like eateries, convenience stores, shopping malls, etc. Strongly recommended.

This was my first experience in Asia in general so I was pleased with a different type of hotel offering, from having all sorts of in-room amenities (toothbrushes, shaving kit, etc.) and a bidet, and think it is a great hotel overall. Having said that, a couple things could be a bit better: the bed wasn't overly comfy (but not terrible). I also had a broken coffee maker at first, though it was replaced the next day (and it is a Nespresso, that's another plus!). The shower isn't great - kind of short, but it worked out in the end. The restaurant inside the hotel has some great breakfast options, too.

If you are staying the easiest walk although it's a fair walk is by taking the West Exit from Shinjuku station- walk past the big glass eye on the wall. It's a long but easy walk down a long bright tunnel then a quick left at crossing and you are at the rear entrance.Rooms were fairly spacious - we stayed twice and great views from both side we were on. Easy check in and out- a lot of staff at hand so no waiting. The staff were extremely helpful and no issues if you only speak EnglishRoom has all amenities you can need- no iron but you can send to laundry.Lots of restaurant choices and bars -we only did breakfast and chose Jurin restaurant. Great buffet and friendly service. And important for me one of the few place to get a milky hot pot of black teaHotel also has transport to Disneyland and Disney sea , also can book airport limo bus. There is a chart at bell desk showing availability.You can also use Narita express train from Narita airport- not sure about other airportsCurrency exchange machine in lobby, convenience store with food drinks alcohol souvenirs . Close enough to walk to Shinjuku main area lots of shops food etc. you can spend so much time just browsing Shinjuku area alone but easy JR train of metro access to lots of Tokyo sightsI would recommend this hotel and definitely stay again. thanks Keio Plaza.

good location, close to shops, railway station etc but rooms and facilities in the rooms looking a bit old. shortage of power points for phones, ipads and laptops is noticeable.plenty of great restaurants downstairs. staff all very polite and willing to help

Stayed here for two days, not satisfied with the quality of the hotel, and it was very crowded when I visited. The receptionist not as helpful as the price of service that I paid. The amenities are complete but the decoration of the room is old. the good thing about this hotel: location near Shinjuku, and there are a lot of good restaurants in the hotel. The breakfast buffet is quite nice.

Stayed three nights here. Had a double room in the main tower.it was clean and comfortable for both my wife and I. Shinjuku station was just walking distance and that was so convenient to travel to shibuya, harajuku. Getting here from Haneda airport was so easy via the airport limousine which stopped right at the hotel entrance. Buffet breakfast was good, we tried the two Restaurants in the hotel. The metropolitan building was just right in front and so convenient to go to the observation deck on 45th floor for view of Tokyo unfortunately couldn't view Mt. Fuji due to weather conditions.

This is a very large hotel with lots of eating places to cover everyone also there is five bars two of which are on the 45 floor and offer spectacular views over the area. The location even though is not in the heart of Tokyo has heaps of cafes restaurants and shops not to mention easy access to all trains. Highly recommend this hotel.

I like the service. The friendly,helpful and knowledgable staffs. The staffs hotel also speak English fluently. Good location, spacious and clean rooms.The hotel is exactly at the centre of Shinjuku. Easy to book the airport limousine bus either to Narita and Haneda airport.

My only complaint is the wifi service keeps getting disconnected or slows down more so if you need to do a video conference or VOIP call. Signal drops and/or slows down. Staff is very attentive and courteous

The staff barely spoke a word of English and will not try to extend themselves whatsoever. We were told that we had to pay an extra 4000 yen to use the swimming pool (which has been closed for weeks) which is absolutely ridiculous considering we are paying $330 AUD per night. When I asked to speak to a supervisor to complain I was told that there was no one to speak to. Any request we had was fobbed off by front desk staff and the communication barrier left me feeling frustrated. Would definitely not recommend this hotel. Terrible experience and when I told them I wanted to provide feedback I was told to just fill out a form provided in the room.

I chose this hotel because of the availability of bus shuttles either through Haneda or Narita. I also found out that the hotel is well located within Shinjuku, a bit away from the crowds but still within walking distance of the shops, eateries and the train station. The room is clean, service is fine, and offers great options for breakfast. The staff are generally helpful.

This hotel is easily accessible by trains and it has free shuttle buses to Disney land. It also has a pick up point for the airport limousine buses. A short distance from Shinjuku shopping area. Lots of food to choose from the nearby area.

Large rooms, friendly, courteous and knowledge staff. Enjoyed the wonderful breakfast buffets (complementary) but if paying out of pocket, it was quite expensive to me. Proximity to lots of local eateries and shopping (walk generally toward "Times Square"). Would love to return to this hotel if visiting Tokyo again.

I was attending a conference. This hotel was fine with one major exception. There was no place to sit down in the public areas! Lobby, public meeting areas, hallways, etc. There was absolutely no place to sit down and have a chat with someone. Since conferences are mainly for networking purposes, I found this to be a big annoyance.The checkin was too slow. There was a long queue. Further, the hotel allowed absolutely no checkin before 2 pm. I know that rooms were available before then once they are cleaned... they should be made available as they are cleaned. But the hotel forced everybody to wait until 2 pm.There was also a queue for the dining room. The queue was very long and it took at least 20 minutes to get in to breakfast. This is not good... the hotel needs to upgrade its dining facilities.

Keio Plaza is a very modern, comfortable and large hotel. Our room was good, but positioning a small table and chairs next to the bed gave us very little floor room to place our suitcases. The room was immaculately clean. My main concern wherever I stay is that the bed is comfortable and that the shower is hot and strong - perfect! Free wifi in the room, but had to sign in every time it was used (you get an envelope with the network/password when you check in).A great service offered by the hotel is a free shuttle bus to Disneyland - make sure you book a time, as places fill fast. The lovely staff who booked our place were so helpful. They also let me borrow a power conversion plug, which was much appreciated.There is a smoking room on the ground floor where you can attempt to chat to people from all over the world! (Smokers chat to everyone). We were there during the Olympic volleyball qualifier (8 countries), and many of the athletes smoke!! Breakfast was offered in three rooms down the escalator, and the staff were very efficient and pleasant, even when you had to wait in a queue at busy times. The food selection was good, and the egg chef was fun to watch - fast and friendly.Walking out the back door, you can walk for 10 minutes to the left and find a lovely garden to stroll around, or if you walk to the right through a huge subway, you find the Shinjuku Station and a large shopping complex. Across the road are some good places to eat - one called Royal or Regal or something?? sorry - was excellent value for money. Food at the Hotel was a bit expensive, but they had a great convenience store, and other retail outlets there.Great central location for a trip to Tokyo. We did a day trip to Nikko and the hotel is on the list for pick up points, which was very handy. Would definitely stay there again.

We were pleased with our attractive, modern room in this large hotel full of business travelers and tour groups (like ours). There are several (expensive) restaurants, and the breakfast buffet was substantial and delicious. For a luxurious treat, enjoy a cocktail and snack at the rooftop bar: it's worth the cost. Shinjuku is outside the center of Tokyo, but the hotel is within a short walk of the major train station and other transit stations. Shopping is convenient--at least two major department stores with their fabulous food halls are close at hand--and numerous small restaurants are just blocks away; these cater to the nearby student population so are very reasonable. We enjoyed our stay.

For my son's birthday and our wedding anniversary, we vacationed from May4-8 in Tokyo. My wife booked Keio Plaza, across the grand Tokyo metropolitan government building.The hotel is impressive. It's lobby is very spacious. Its check-in staff, efficient and gracious. We stayed in a room on the 25/F with a good city scape view. The room, sufficient and efficient for the 3 of us was well appointed. The icing on the cake of course is the famed Japanese bathroom and in particular the electronic toilet. Thought bubble: if I win the lotto, I'd have one like it in Manila where I live.The selection of eating places in the hotel is very satisfying. My son particularly looks forward to breakfast. We have 4 venues to choose from. The entrees included Japanese staples. I loved the DIY miso soup, fresh and very tasty!My wife and I loved the exhibits in the various places of the hotel. That time, there hats of varying styles and eras and for which purpose. Interesting as I live in the tropics and hats are more the bull caps and not really as regal or artsy.But I also found the convenient store very well-stocked and its meal offerings very good, tasty and satisfying. Quality is high. I bought several items there and I was very happy I did. The hotel's location is great. Nearby is a train station. We ventured to sample the eating joints near it but we did not try to take the train. Keio Plaza hotel in Tokyo is more than OK for me. When we return to Tokyo, I am sure we will book here again.

Loved the hotel. Very accessible to the subway which allowed you to go throughout the city. There are alot of authentic restaurants around the hotel as well. Also good shopping. The restaurants in the hotel were a little pricey ($28 for a medium pizza) but the food was delicious. Great breakfast selection as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

This was a well received stop over prior to heading home. Time to unwind and get ready for home. The staff, the rooms etc were excellent. The location of the hotel is perfect to be able to walk out the front door, shop and be part of the local charm without having to use any transport at all.....We are overwhelmed by the humility and respect the Japanese have for each and everyone.Recommend the Hotel highly if travelling through or even making it your home base if staying in Japan for an extended stayBarry and SuzanneOrmiston , BrisbaneAustralia

My husband and I bought a Grabaseat Escape package to Tokyo that included 5 nights at this hotel, and we were so impressed.Firstly, the staff were very friendly, polite and really went out of their way to help us when we needed it. Overall their English was very good as well. The stores in the hotel were super handy, and the convenience store prices were comparable to other stores in the area. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurants but had Japanese room service breakfast and had a few drinks in the lounge on the 45th floor. The view of Tokyo from the lounge is amazing. Breakfast arrived exactly on time and did not disappoint. Good value for money considering the quality and quantity of food. I'd highly recommend this treat to yourself at least once!The bar was lovely, great view, good drinks list, comfy chairs and a relaxed ambience.Our room was incredibly spacious for Tokyo and was well appointed. It was kept to a high standard of cleanliness throughout our stay.Personally this location suited us perfectly. The underground passage to the main Shinjuku train entrance is right outside, easy to navigate and full of hidden gems of shops and eateries. It is comfortable walking distance to Central Shinjuku and across the road from the (free) Government Building's observatory. It was easy to book shuttle buses to and from the airport. We had a great time here and would highly recommend.

I've been to this hotel twice and felt like it deserved a review. 7/10 The hotel room itself is a pretty standard sized Japanese hotel room. There were 3 of us and we all got in pretty snug. Just enough room for the suitcases go lay flat and open on the floor with some room to move around. 10/10 The service was amazing. Most staff I encountered spoke English and very accommodating! Had a bit of trouble with shopping and reception was with me on the phone for 30 min trying to solve it (thank you). There is also a convenient store in the south tower, bottom floor (very convenient). 8/10 great location! Right next to shopping boutiques, Yodabashi, 24/7 restaurants and a short walk to Shinjuku train station7/10 cleanliness. Can't really explain why as not much to complain about but just the overall feel of it didn't deserve more than 7.

Check In : No early check in Location : Near the train station and lot of shopping around In-room Dining : Ok Gym: Please don't call it a fitness center , it's just a fitness room with treadmill and basic weights.

We were in the plaza luxe levels, it didn't cost much on booking to be there. The room was spacious, air conditioned, good to channels, and well appointed shower. This was a great base and only 300m from the station, it is in good location to the typical centre of Shinjuku and just far out enough so you could try little lunch places away from the huge crossings, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this massive hotel.

We stayed there in 6/16, the staff was very helpful and many understood english, the rooms very nice and clean with great views of shinjuku, the kph is just a few blocks from the shinjuku station which is not only a train station but has tons of shopping oppertunities and good food fyi we used JTB and got great deal

The Keio Plaza is certainly a luxury hotel. In Tokyo finding a hotel with a comfortable bed where you can open your suitcase without blocking the bed or the room is rare. Decedent conditioned air, a comfortable bed and a nespresso machine what else can you ask for?The answer is a stunning view over Tokyo. Wow.

Stayed in this hotel for 3 days. Great location, breakfast with wide selection, basically clean and more than enough bedroom space. Aircon maintains comfortable temperature. Bathroom clean and has adequate space. Shower pressure and temperature goodMinor issue is that we requested/booked for a double/ queen bed, but given a room with 2 twin beds. The bed though, was alright, no problem sleeping.This is a very big hotel with more than a thousand rooms, i think. Sometimes it gets too busy, service is affected. Still a good hotel, especially with its location and room size.

Our room was fantastic; clean and spacious with good city views. I'm sure some of the west-facing rooms would offer a view of Mt. Fuji, way off in the distance. The sky-top lounge offered exquisite views of Tokyo to the east while enjoying light snacks and yummy drinks. The hotel is adjacent to many restaurants and shopping but it also has good restaurants right in the building. There is an underground tunnel from here to the Shinjuku station, making commuting to/from the airport, or to the sights in the city, very convenient. There is also a free observation deck in the government building just to the west of this hotel. We found this hotel expensive, but the experience and location made it worth the price.

We stayed at Keio plaza hotel it was great hotel in an ideal location close to the train station & major bus terminal our room was Very Spacious, modern and immaculate,we were given an invitation to enjoy free drinks & nibbles in the guest lounge,which we thoughtless enjoyed,we recommend to friends.

Just a few steps from the vibrant Shinjuku restaurants as well as shopping and more! Easy to get to all the railway system to get to other parts of Tokyo. Room was perfect with a view. I just loved it. Come early for breakfast or you'll wait in line. But there are a total of 3 breakfast places to choose from. Jurin restaurant was very busy because it is VERY GOOD and continental for everyone to like.

Near major dept stores and close to Shinjuku. Very helpful staff, some of whom speak English remarkably well. The room was clean and beds very comfy. The in room shiatsu is phenomenal and we requested it multiple times as the ladies who do it are experts. I also got the relaxation facial which was great
user_name:
MarkoandElisa
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of our trip. It is very well located just a five minute walk from Shinjuku station. The rooms are clean and welcoming, though they have usual Japanese hallmark of being slightly smaller than rooms in similar hotels in other countries. The staff are very friendly and did everything possible to assist us. There are bars on the top floor with fantastic views over the city and the breakfast has a large array of options.

When I booked the room via expedia, I was not careful and only select one traveller instead of two. Normally it should not be a big deal with most hotels because I select a standard room with double bed and rate is usually the same. However I had a huge issue when I was checking in, the staff can barely speak English and I couldnot understand her half of the time. In the end, I was told you have to pay extra 6500 Yen, I was ok with it because I quickly checked the website and the difference between one traveller and two travellers is around 18 AUD per night. I was shocked when I checked out by getting a bill of 240 AUD, so instead of 18 aud a night, it was 80 AUD a night! Again, the staff could not speak English properly, I was tried explaining the situation and ended up paying the bill. I tried to look for an email and write a letter to this hotel, however, I was not able to get any email address from its official website. Tokyo is such a nice city to go to however my experience of Keio plaza hotel totally ruined it!

We had our room upgraded and enjoyed the space! The staff were really helpful in showing us around our room too. The view is also great!It's about a 10-15 minute walk from Shinjuku station and it's mostly sheltered, so you're safe from the rain. There's also direct airport transfer at about the same cost as the Narita Express, sans the walking, changing trains and squeezing.

A great hotel well positioned in Shinjuku, Tokyo. Bathroom was well appointed.Bedroom was larger than most of the other hotels we've stayed at in Japan.We found the wifi to be more than satisfactory.They even provided two free bottles of water. Excellent staff. English was not a problem.For a small fee they can organise airport transfers. We had an excellent experience and would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in Tokyo.

The hotel was easy to locate from Shinjuku station and located away from the hustle and bustle of busy Shinjuku station. The rooms were typical Japanese size and well-appointed. Nothing out to the ordinary for the price that we were paying for. Major plus point was its proximity to the bus station and its free shuttle arrangement with DisneyLand/DisneySea, making it easy for us to catch our 6am rides. They also have a ticket machine that allows you to conveniently buy all airport shuttle tickets.The lobby tends to get crowded so buffer in additional time if you intend to speak to the concierge etc.

There are many reasons for choosing this hotel over other Singaporean-recommended hotels around Shinjuku area is accessibility. 1) If you plan to take the Airport Limousine Bus service from Haneda or Narita Airport, the bus will stop exactly in front of this hotel which makes it very convenient for us with luggages and a toddler stroller. The porters helped to unload the luggages and bring into the holding area for us. 2) Keio Plaza Hotel is one of few Disney Good Neighbour Hotels which provides complimentary bus shuttle services to Tokyo Disney Resort (Land & Sea). This is also an important factor for us as we were travelling with a senior and a toddler. However, a word of advice if you wish to take the shuttle bus, you need to inform the hotel reception the moment you have decided on the date you wish to go to Disney Resort, preferably at the moment you book your hotel as they only have three timings: 7.30am, 9.30am and 12.30pm. As you have guessed, the two earlier timings are the most popular timings and they are always fully booked. The same goes for return timings. 3) Accessible to Shinjuku JR Station which is also the interchange for the various train lines like Oedo line etc. There are a few ways to walk to the station as the hotel has a few exits so be sure to check with the hotel staff before moving off. I would recommend the West exit with the taxi stand as you will get to walk past many shops such as Lawson, Yodobashi and eateries such as Subway, Starbucks, Pronto, Sushi bars etc. From the West exit, you are 10-minute leisure walk from the shopping area at Shinjuku ranging from Keio Shopping Mall (Yes, it's sister company of Keio Plaza Hotel. There is 5% discount for Keio Plaza Hotel stayers), MyLord, Lumine, Takashimaya Time Square, Tokyo Hands, Uniqlo etc. 4) Newly renovated South Tower with high floor rooms was an attraction to me when I was searching for hotels in Shinjuku. We know how small the hotel room in Tokyo can be so when we saw this, we decided to choose the Plaza Superior Rooms (20F above) to get a good view. We were not disappointed. The room is spacious and even has a space for coffee table and sofa to lounge around. The toilet is also spacious. 5) Excellent service from the staff. a) Online support: When we booked the hotel via a third party hotel booking site, we contacted the hotel to confirm our booking. They were very prompt in replying and also detected and alerted us of multiple bookings from us (We tried to book from Booking.com and another site). They also took note of our request to have two rooms side by side. b) Porter Bell Hop Service: When we reached the hotel by the Airport Limousine Bus, the porters promptly took our luggages and ushered us to the bell hop counter to issue us a stud for the deposit of our luggages without us asking so that we can go and shop until the check-in timing at 2pm.c) Reception: Even though we were not issued a room before 2pm, the staff at the reception counter issued us a temporary wifi login and password for us to assess internet for our planning. They even have maps of train stations ready to guide us to the places we want to go. I am particularly impressed by this trainee at the reception counter, Yuzaki. She served us when we asked about the one-day tour package to Mt Fuji and Hakone. She was very patient to share with us the different types of packages offered by different companies as well as helped us to book the package and explain about the type of food served for the lunch. We pushed the boundary by asking her to help us find nearby shops that sell Anello bags. Yuzaki went the extra mile by calling the company to find out about the resellers' stores nearby and she even asked if we have a certain model that we are looking for, so that she can direct us there to buy. That's what I call great personalised service! d) Room Service. On our first night, we requested for a bed guard for our bed so that our little boy will not roll off the bed when sleeping. The service staff came within a short time and installed the guard for us. The room cleaning service did an excellent job in ensuring our toiletries and amenities are always restocked and the bath tub was scrubbed clean. e) Sunrise Tour Agency is in this hotel. If you wish to book a Day Tour to Mt Fuji, you would most probably heard of Sunrise Agency which provides such day tours. Good thing is that you can book it at the reception and meet directly at your hotel lobby for pickup. f) Good restaurants and a convenience store within the hotel. The convenience store sells a variety of food and beverages and even souvenirs of Hello Kitty and Disney characters.There are a few restaurants for you to choose and dine from.Bottom line: Get a high floor hotel room. There is great service from staff.

The location is very close to Shinjuku station. So it is very easy to get around the city by public transport.There are also so many restaurants and shops around.The hotel staff are very nice. The American buffet breakfast in not perfect but acceptable yet the restaurant has nice big windows with a view of the adjacent street.The room is bigger and more comfortable than other hotels we've been staying in Japan.

This is a good place to stay for holiday. Near Shinjuku area, great for tokyo tour as it is near.train station. Good service with the hotel staff and very good condition of rooms and facility. Recommended.

Service stsff are very nice. But I can`t use your wifi to do the review on TripAdvisor. I have to do this via my own wifi. It is unbelievable that the wifi is too slow to use web for such a wondweful hotel.

Travel May 2016, it was my 2nd time staying in this hotel and i always satisfied with the service, the room and cleanliness. Room: booked superior renovated room for 3 people and the extra bed was pretty comfortable and the room is spacious for Japan standard. View of the room is Government building.Service: Staff are very polite, speak basic english..They even declined when i gave them tips as one of the lady sent me to my room and i have like 6 luggage with me and she carried herself. (in Japan, not necessarily to give tips but i will still give for those super great service)Easy access from airport with limousine bus stop direct at the airport, check in time is 2PM, however you can put your luggage with the concierge and they are very nice. 10 mins walking to Shinjuku station, this hotel have many entrance, so make sure you choose the right entrance to go to Station otherwise you will walk further. Overall, very very satisfied.

We didn't stay at the hotel, but we could enjoy the Japanese tea ceremony, sitting in a tatami room. Our host explained to us very well about the ceremony and its link to nature as a part of Japanese culture.We only wish we could have tried our hand on some part of the ceremony! But the experience does not include making tea yourself.For those who can't sit on tatamis they also offer the ceremony on chairs.

We were served by a very friendly and smiley Ms Yamamoto upon check-in. She was very nice and helpful in our request for adjoining rooms.Booked two rooms - one double and one triple at the renovated South Wing. The rooms and the toilets were very clean and spacious.The three beds in the triple room were all proper beds unlike some hotels which give you sofa bed which is uncomfortable. The pillows were also very comfortable .Location is also a plus point. About 10 mins walk to Shinjuku station so it is very convenient.Overall very happy with this hotel and will definitely stay here again for the next visit.

Excellent, comfortable room. Very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was also excellent with a large variety of dishes.Close to subway, parks, Government tower building for free access to the viewing floors.Convenience store on site for your beer and other requirements.Definitely will start there again :-)

A short walk from Shinjuku station makes this a very well placed hotel. The room was comfortable, and even the lifts fast, which was useful as we were in the south tower very high up. There were queues for breakfast in the larger restaurant, so we swopped over to the European venue, which was less crowded with an enormous variety of breakfast options. On the last day we discovered a subway from the station to the back of the hotel - very useful if it were raining.

The service was incredible, the staff was so helpful and the location was amazing. I would highly recommend staying here! The Sake bar on the first floor was a favorite starting point for us before venturing out into the city at night. (Avoid the bars/restaurants at the top they are overpriced and mediocre).

Keio Plaza hotel is quite expensive at about $400 per night for room with queen bed. You would expect the service provided to be on par with the price we are paying. 1.) Some days of room service was terrible with our clothes that were left on bed crumpled and thrown at the corner of the Room. 2.) When we were booking for the bus to disney we were served by the most impatient and impolite bell captain Ito san. He even clicked his tongue few times when we asked about other timings for the bus. In the end he told us that there is no more return bus on that day and all were fully booked but surprisingly when we approached another female staff there were suddenly seats available and when we asked if some one has cancelled, her reply was no. The seats were always available. Good luck to you if your bell captain is Ito san. By the way we had also officially complained to their management on this. 3.) On the first day of checkin, my creditcard company informed me that an amount of $7000+ has been charged by Keio Plaza. This is normal as hotels usually does this. But on the last night of my stay, I was asked to make payment at 1am for the hotel before checkout on the next day. The reason given was my credit card was rejected. I showed my creditcard online statement and it clearly showed the $7000+ that was charged and I ask the person at the cashier to try my card. But without trying he keep insisting it is rejected. I had to wake my wife up at 130am to ask her to come down with her creditcard while I made calls to my bank. My bank informed me that there is nothing wrong and Keio Plaza should be able to charge my card. The cashier still do not want to try and started calling mastercard and only when mastercard confirmed there is no issue that he tried my card and of course there was no problem charging. All in all this wasted 30 to 45 mins of my time in the middle of the night. I had to wake my wife up as well and suffer the strange looks from other guests. I have previously stayed at Keio Plaza several times but this will most likely be my last. I don't mind paying more but at the very least the service provided should be on par with the amount you are charging.Fyi two queen size rooms were booked for my family of 5 (2 adults , 2 child and 1 baby)

We enjoyed our stay at Keio Plaza Hotel very much! The location was close to Shinjuku station, rooms very clean, delicious breakfast buffet, and kind staff. There are several restaurants to select from, also there are nice convenience stores right in the hotel for light snacks, drinks, gifts, etc. Most of the staff speaks very good English. Everyone is very kind to foreign travelers.

Stayed in superior room in south tower. Wonderful views. Service of all staff including housekeeping, bell hops was excellent. Only negative was insufficient toilet facilities available in lobby. Long queues.

(1) Greeted by friendly and helpful hotel staff who could speak English; hence I felt more at ease to check with them on how to get around in Japan;(2) Love the proximity to Shinjuku station; within 5-10 min , depending which exit/entrance you want to get in(3) Love the area where you get food easily with great variety of restaurants & shopping in keio Mall, Takashimaya, Lumine, Newoman etc (4) Love the hotel room which comes with 4 individual beds as well as a dressing room. Of course, love the room view which shows the skyscrapers in Tokyo!

I had stayed a lot of times in this hotel and today when I'm checking in, I encountered the worst experiences. I had booked a smoking room with king bed stated due to previous 2 encounters that I suffered severe backache. And also, despite my numerous stays in this hotel, they do not store any details of my iPrefer member Nor their own hotel member as I have both. I even had my conditions stated in the booking via my travel agent and the front desk seems do not have any information. I was only offered a smoking room with single bed which left me unhappy as this is not the first time they are doing this, and till I argued that I had informed almost a month earlier on my condition, then they upgraded me. The worst is the staff can tell me that it is only for this time that they upgraded me. It is you who make the mistake and you make me feel like I'm begging you for an upgrade??!! That's ridiculous. I would seriously consider to continue to use this hotel and also to write them off my corporate list.

Massive hotel containing every amenity you could wish for.Great location, a five minute stroll from Shinjuku station and surrounding shopping area.Despite being so well sited, the room I was in on the 24th floor was really quiet.Massive size room, especially by Tokyo standards with every gadget, TV, DVD and music player, master light control, kettle etc., and an alarm clock that doesn't require a degree in engineering to set! Good AC also and free wifi. Everything worked as it is supposed to!Bathroom supplied with all necessary toiletries and replenished daily.Clean and comfortable, good linens and feather pillows.There are numerous restaurants and bars, also several shops including a convenience store. They all are a little overpriced but that's the price you pay for having everything on site. One can always go outside the hotel if you want to price shop however.Did phone room service to request some ice which arrived in minutes, ditto when I ask to use an iron. Very impressive considering the size of the hotel.All the staff have been very helpful and there always seems to be someone somewhere available to guide or assist.Can't really fault this hotel at all as for such a big complex it seems to function very efficiently and does indeed provide every service a tourist in Tokyo could want.

Booked this hotel online, was quick and easy. I booked the Plaza Luxe Double, Non Smoking with Free access to the lounge and included free wifi. We booked this hotel because of the reviews, location and our agenda. We were in Tokyo for the first 5 nights of our trip. We were able to get around throughout tokyo, no issues for noise, or disturbance around the hotel. The money we spent on this hotel was well worth the value we received.The room, was facing the large government building, very high up, we could see pretty far in each direction. The room was spacious, clean, and organized. One of the largest rooms that we stay in during Japan. The room had complimentary water, qtips. Our first night at the hotel we arrived fairly late, we took a bus from the airport, the hotel was the last stop for the bus, or the second last stop. I recommend the bus to the hotel from the airport. The first night was the only night we ordered room service. Room service was fairly quick, ordered sushi and onigiri. Everything was good. During our stay the rooms were kept clean and organized, we were never rushed or disturbed.We had access to the lounge and went once during the day and once during the evening. Beautiful room, lots of snacks and drinks. The views from this hotel are beautiful.Around the hotel - food, food, food, couple of sight seeing attractions (government building with beautiful views).I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Tokyo it's a must. You can see a lot of attractions and the hotel has many different restaurants.

We didn't stay at this hotel, but we went to the tea ceremony on the 10th floor. It was a truly memorable experience - Very authentic and performed with expertise and passion. It was easy to find from Shinjuku Station and the online booking process via the hotel's web-site was simple too.

Great hotel, but its big! ...the choice of different types of breakfast was very good....and an excellent locationThe room was very comfortable in size for Japan and well decorated...good WIFI and very good service from the staff in general. Located close to the train station and to restaurants, bars, etc. All in all a wonderful experience...

When you pay a decent amount for a hotel that advertises WiFi, you expect Wifi to be working. When I stayed the WiFi was not working and the Keio was such a bureaucratic place that they couldn't fix it in time while I stayed. They didn't offer a refund either. So check carefully, when hotels like this claim to have certain features like Wifi, they often don't check they are working before guests check in. Or they don't have systems in place to fix the WiFi in time for guests that stay.

A very nice hotel in clean, safe neighborhood with a number of very good dining and shopping options nearby. When we didn't want the buffet breakfast at the hotel (it was rather expensive), we found nice coffee shops with pastries very close to the hotel. Shinjuku station is a very short walk away, and an adventurous person can quickly pick up on the subway system. It's a people watching ride to any place in Tokyo!

This is a stunning hotel, in a great location, with a dedicated walkway to Shinjuku station (one of Tokyo's biggest hubs for both subway and trains). There are also a ton of great bars and restaurants right on your doorstep. If like us you want the liveliness of Shinjuku, but without some of the sleaziness of the kabuki-cho area, then this is the perfect solution. One word of warning: be careful not to book a smoking room unless you are a smoker, as they really stick! That said, they kindly amended our room selection after a booking mix up and we LOVED LOVED our room with a spectacular view.

By far one of the best hotels in Shinjuku/Tokyo area. Very conveniently located, few hundred meters to Shinjuku station. The rooms are spacious, and its a huge hotel complex. with multiple wings too. The hotel is extremely popular with locals and tourists and was extremely busy all through my stay. The hotel has a Airport limo pick up facility so its very convenient to travel back to airport too. Room amenities are just fantastic The place is highly recommended.

It was my first time in Tokyo in May and after some searching I chose this hotel. Shinjuku station is HUGE but there was great signage showing the way to the hotel. Its roughly a 10 minute walk from the station (WEST EXIT) to the hotel. The hotel is very nice, clean and the staff are very helpful.My room had twin queen beds and was very comfortable. There was an automatic window blind to keep out the sunshine in the morning (essential for jet-lag). Breakfast was included as part of my business package and it was a very tasty buffet.Overall a very pleasant stay

A good pick. Convenient location with about 10 minutes walk to train. Lots of great restaurants close by & good shopping of all kind incl Dept. stores like Takashimaya. Very large hotel & good pick-up point for trips & to Airports.Our room was spacious & comfortable for Tokyo considering space limitations. Not cheap in peak season but you get what you pay for.

The hotel was conveniently located to the Shinjuku station and made it very easy to travel all over the Shinjuku, Shibuya, Asakasa, etc. area. The hotel staff were very accommodating and our room had 2 bathrooms as well as a vanity/makeup area.Unfortunately, we only had the opportunity to eat the daily breakfast buffet which was very good but we wanted to try the other restaurants as we had read other reviews that said that they were very good. We hope to return in the future!

Our first trip to Japan began with 5 nights in Tokyo. This was the longest we were to spend in one location and, even though we knew we would be spending very little time in our room, we wanted more spacious accommodation where we could unpack fully and feel 'at home'. It was also important to be close to public transport options. The Keio Plaza Hotel fully met our expectations. A luxury express bus from Nerita airport delivered us directly to the hotel, which is only a five minute stroll to Shinjuku station (where we managed to get lost on several occasions, but that is another story). Our room was large, even by western standards, modern and very well appointed. Wifi access was good. Although we ate out most of the time, the hotel boasts a number of restaurants, whilst the downstairs bar offers a pleasant way to end a long day. All in all, a great start to our two week holiday.

So conveniently located. Airport shuttle buses drop off & pixk up right at the hotel. Not near it - right up to the door. Short walk to Shinjuku station - the busiest in the world! Also, many tours originate at this hotel so no need to wake up any earlier than you have to. Staff is very nice and helpful. English spoken by almost everyone. We requested a view of Fuji and got it. It was only clear for 1 of 6 days, but at least we got one. Government building with free top floor observation deck is directly behind the hotel. Opted to pay a little more for access to the Club where they serve complimentary beer & wine in the evening. And there's a nice view from there as well. Our room was quite large, which i did not expect to find in Tokyo. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and exploring Tokyo for the first time.

For me one of the best hotels I ever stayed. Huge hotel with several restaurants and Bar.The rooms are very big for Japan standards and the bathroom was marvelous, with a very powerfull shower and a strong and well putted ilumination.In the center of the shinjuku district it has the train and the subway at the door. Near the hotel there is a tower bulding with an open view of all the city. It,s free and very good to spend part of the morning.
